description:
One of the most esthetic and study/work-friendly cafe in the Richmond district! 

I feel like I have stepped into a space which mirrors  my dream cafe! I truly adore every detail they put together on this cafe, it is just beautiful! I am also stunned by the restroom! They provide pads for the ladies! I guess I wouldn't be the first one complimented on their thoughtfulness but I would still like to recognize how considerate this place is designed for their customers.  

I will definitely visit this cafe again ;)
author: Shuyi L.

description:
I have only good things to say about this coffee shop: first of all, it's beautiful and I wish my house looked like this. Second, the staff is very friendly and engaging: they knew the names of a lot of their regulars who came in which i thought was nice. And lastly, the drinks are great. They served me my tea in a wine glass which was super cute. I came here today to do work and I can confirm that it's a good spot to work as the tables are large and the WiFi is fast.

They are a bit different than other coffee shops because they also serve beer and other drinks so people come in the evening to drink and hang out until they close at 9.
author: Sydney G.

description:
This is my absolute favorite cafe - not just in the Richmond District, not just in San Francisco, but pretty much anywhere I've lived or visited before! When you go to Orson's, you don't just get great food, coffee, wine, and beer; you also get the friendliest, happiest owners that know and care about their customers and will welcome you by name, and a great crowd of locals and visitors alike. 

Orson's Belly truly is the "family room" of the neighborhood. Come here for good vibes, delicious eats and a welcoming environment. It's a great place to do work, hang out with friends, and meet new people. For my friends and I that live in the neighborhood, Orson's basically feels like an extension of our own home! I even created a Yelp account just to give this place a good review. Seriously, go here!
author: Madeleine F.

description:
So sad I discovered this place at the end of my time in SF. Such a great place to kill a few hours with friends or get work done. Plenty of seating and wall outlets, very solid cappuccino, and an awesome list of small plates that are beautifully plated and great for sharing and snacking. 

The olives are actually incredible. They bathe in oil and Italian herbs, which gives then this lovely sweetness to balance out the saltiness. Seriously you might resist chewing them they're so good just to let rest on the tongue. A surprisingly crisp exterior and juicy interior that will have you craving more. The hummus was also great, not my absolute favorite but the pita is fluffy and its ideal for sharing.
author: Jason S.

description: Came in here for coffee and the "hand smashed avocado bagel". Coffee was a bit meh, but they really nailed to food! Excellent service, beautiful presentation, nice flavors, and big enough to be split between two people (unless you are starved). The ambiance was cool too - though you are definitely tucked away in a super residential area.
author: Ankita K.

description:
I've been here twice to work and plan to come back. It feels less like a cafe and more like a neighborhood living room. They have books and some board games, but also accessible outlets. There is also a silent film that gets projected on one wall, so there's always something interesting to look at.

A lot of their food is homemade, like the museli and the muhamarra. They are worth the price, so definitely try them both! The museli is technically on their breakfast menu, but the owners are super accommodating and let us order it at 6 PM. According to the owner, the most popular item is the belgian waffle, which I plan to try next time.

Lots of natural lighting and a low buzz of conversation make for all around good vibes. Definitely worth stopping by if you're in the Richmond. Also--no extra charge for almond milk!
author: Rachel L.

description:
I really like this place, super close to home, the owners are sweet and fun, the food is good, the cafe is great, but for the love of god, you guys are SO expensive! Over the top expensive! A Turkish breakfast and 2 aperol spritz for $43?? Way way too much! 
You make it really unpleasant/ very hard to come and enjoy a morning/ evening at your place.. :/
author: Ravit B.

description: Such a cute study spot! It's located in a small neighborhood so there's not much traffic which is nice. Parking was a little difficult, but i found some street parking and there's no meters and no time limit (amazing) Me and my friends came here to study and the staff were so sweet in suggesting drinks and food. Caffe Latte was great and the muhammara was so tasty coming from someone who has a middle eastern background... tasted just like the one i make at home. It's definitely an aesthetically pleasing environment. Made studying so much more tolerable!! Will be back.
author: Maddy D.

description:
I came here much later in the day an hour before it closed, so I didn't want to stay too long. I noticed a few customers were there to relax and read. It is definitely a great atmosphere. 

There was a wide variety of coffee, wine, beer, drinks, etc. and a nice menu with small bites. I decided on a cappuccino and a smoked salmon smørrebrød! It was delicious and it was beautifully crafted. The staff were very nice and seemed to be very lively. Engaged with the customers about different drinks and just genuinely enjoying themselves. My order was personally delivered even after moving around. I genuinely would come back here again to try some of their other menu items.
author: Tianna N.

description: Spent a beautiful Sunday today thanks to Orson's Belly and the nearby Rose Garden at GGP. I wasn't aware that their Lox Smørrebrød was for dinner but one of the owners, Cigdem, was very kind to accommodate my order for a late lunch (around 2pm). I also had an almond latte, I think she said it's from De La Paz coffee. I love the concept of this place so much! I think they were also playing one of Orson Welles' movies but with no sound, instead they were playing some music that reminded me of Ólafur Arnalds and such. It was fairly quiet with a comfortable atmosphere. Definitely a lovely local joint in the area. Thank you, Cem and Cigdem! Can't wait to try your Turkish Coffee on my next visit.
author: Erica R.

description:
Found this place while searching for cafes near my Airbnb. Usually when I travel I prefer to go to local cafes vs. coffee shop chains like Starbucks. It was a 5 min walk from where I was staying so that was a huge plus. 

I really liked the atmosphere, it was very bright and open. Everyone was nice and it just gave off a vibe of a neighborhood cafe where everyone knows each other.

I ordered a caffe latte and the gravlox with an everything bagel. It's basically a deconstructed smoked salmon bagel with cream cheese, capers, and red onions. It's one of my favorite things to eat for breakfast so I decided to give it a try here and OMG it was sooo good! Idk what they did to the onions and pickles but everything just went so well together! Price was a bit expensive in my opinion but totally worth it. Definitely stopping by when I'm in town again!
author: Tam N.

description: Really like this place. Nice interior, simple menu. The owners (I think it was the owners) were really nice and welcoming. I will be back for Apero!
author: Morea P.

description:
Randomly stumbled upon this boutique cafe in the sunset/Richmond Area. I immediately loved the ambiance of this place. A wide selection of coffee styled drinks, cocktails, and beer. 

I went ahead with an order of a latte and their salmon smorrebrod. Both were extremely delicious. The salmon tasted so fresh, for only $10 dollars! That's a steal in SF. 

The staff was super friendly engaging in fun conversation. The order was also personally delivered even after we move around haha. 

I didn't get a chance to look but there was also a wide collection of books available. 

Ill be sure to stop by next time I'm in the area!
author: Nick F.

description:
What a nice little cafe. The service was beyond friendly catering to the needs of wandering tourists, locals walking their dogs, and students who need a quiet place to study. It's a fun and eventful space with a youthful essence that wouldn't detour any onlookers.

Grab a bite with your coffee and stay a while.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Took 40 minutes to produce a less than mediocre cup of coffee and sandwich.

A movie no one can hear is projected on one wall. With only three orders ahead of mine why on Earth it took 38 minutes to produce such an underwhelming yet expensive  sandwich and a latte astounds me. 

At $4.50 the late I ordered took only half my total waiting time and arrived just above cold. I accepted it thinking my sandwich would be arriving on its heals...

Unfortunately the $12.00 cold Tuna sandwich did not arrive for nearly another 20 minutes and looked like it was assembled in 30 seconds! One ball scoop of tuna between two halves of one piece of pita; thus nothing was actually inside the bread allowing its contents to fall out when I tried to eat it.  

What a joke... thank you for failing to address any of the issues I mentioned.
author: Caesar A.

description: Ordered the waffles and it was 1 small waffle with 4 blueberries, powdered sugar and I think some liquid cheap chocolate since they just poorly drizzled it with that thing. Awful food. Management, instead of replying paying costumers feedback with snarky comments improve the quality or don't serve food.
author: Mariano B.

description:
I was visiting my brother in the  and we went walking toward the park. Needed to grab a bite to eat and super glad we picked this place! The bagel was so good i might just fly out there again to have another. Not sure yet. Pic's attached. 
Small place, friendly staff, too. A drip coffee (also very good - their brand is made in The Mission) and this bagel was $11.50. 

Friendly staff 
Welcoming, artistic environment 
Delicious food and coffee
$$
Definitely recommend!
author: Brendan A.

description: This is a cute place in the richmond neighborhood that has plenty of street parking. It is cinematic themed and has some cool decor as well as movies playing in the background. The bagel with hummus was pretty delicious. They have a selection of coffee and beers. A fun quiet space to come and spend an afternoon reading, working, or just people watching.
author: Shristi R.

description:
In my dream life, I live 1 block away from this joint and come here every Sunday so I can sip a cappuccino and eat my bagel while sunlight warms the shop through the big glass windows. 

This is the perfect little neighborhood cafe. Mixture of real food and pastries and the coffee is absolutely delicious. I noticed the beer and champagne options, so there are weekend hangover options too. 

Other pros: free wifi, awesome service, projector that's plays sports/movies/other stuff on one bare wall, and board games to pick from. 

There's one big communal table, a bar, and 5 smaller tables. Also a table outside for folks with pets! Or who like the fog... 

Highly recommended but not too recommended in case this place gets too crowded and I'll have to find someplace new.
author: Steph D.

description:
I recently found out about this cafe relatively near my university and I love it. It's pretty small but the interior is so aesthetically pleasing with these wooden tables, colorful chairs, and art all over the walls. They have instrumental jazz music constantly playing too which is great to study to and I just realized they project silent movies on one of the walls with subtitles, which is perfect for a bit of a study break. 

Both times I've come here I ordered "eat my crepe," the first with a honey drizzle and the second with a chocolate drizzle and it was just a little over $5 each. The crepes were really simple with a bit of powdered sugar on top with jam on the side, but they were really tasty and it'll probably be something I'll order each time I come here. Overall it's becoming one of my favorite little cafes in the Richmond district!
author: Danielle S.

description:
As you know from the other reviews, don't expect to get your order on time.

I'll add that you shouldn't expect to get your order in the order it was received either.

When I come in and order a house coffee, one of the simplest drinks, and then you make the orders of the next three people that came in after me and serve it to them before even starting to make mine... then you start to wonder if there's more to it. When she starts to scream at you, saying you're not entitled to any service after you quietly ask her about how the order of drinks is made, then you know there's some shit going on.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Walking in on a Sunday morning at 11 AM, the first thing I hear waiting in line is another customer asking for a refund of their $4 back.

Ok sure, maybe he just ordered something complicated. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt here. An older gentleman walks in and puts his bag and jacket down right where I was about to sit before he gets in line after me to put his order in.

I sigh and wonder why can't people order first and then go to their seat.

I find another seat after I order and two other people walk in after me to place their order.

I wait for about 15 minutes and the people that were in front of me get their drinks and they walk out.

Another 15 minutes later, one of the owners brings a coffee drink to the old gentlemen that came in after me. After another 5-10 minutes, the two people that ordered after me get their drinks. A sparkly orange drink in a wine glass and a latte.

I go up to ask if my drink has been made and maybe I just didn't see it yet.

"Hi, any update on the black coffee?"

"I haven't forgotten about it. It's right here." she says and points at a half-filled mug. She cuts me off before I even finish saying that.

I sit back down and watch as two other people get their drinks personally delivered to them.

My drink is finally ready and she motions for me to come up and get it at the counter.

I ask, "I have a question."

She cuts me off once again saying, "Yes it's half decaf."

"Not what I was going ask. I'm wondering why the order of your drinks being made seem to be off. I ordered my drink before these 3 and somehow got my drink last."

At this, she threw her hands in the air, and shouts, "Do you have a problem!?"

Well, I didn't. But it seems now we do.

By now, the entire cafe is staring in our direction.

"A house coffee is simple drink. If you have a problem with making my drink for some reason and decided to bump it down on the priority, then I'd like to know why."

At this, she took the coffee back and threw it in the sink, causing a bunch of clanging from the dishes.

"Take your refund and go!"

I gladly obliged. The other owner, presumably the woman's husband handed me the amount in cash.

"Take your friend and get out of here! You think I'm obligated to serve you on time on a Sunday brunch hour?!"

No, but I expect my order to come before those who entered after me, especially if it's a simple drink.

"No wifi!"

Okay...

Is that what's at the top of your mind? The fact that you think I'm here to stay so you delay my order for half an hour for a black coffee? Or was it that you expected me to stay quiet and not confront you on your bullshit?

No thanks. This place ought to be called Orson's Bullshit. This was my first and last time here.

Hire some people if you're stressed out and can't do shit for your customers. Don't take it out on random people.

Might I suggest going to Home Cafe or Pinhole Coffee instead for better service, ambience, and people.
author: Gorlan Y.

description: This place is the best. I love the staff and the food is wonderful. Order anything here, because it will be delightful. The owners are the sweetest people in the world. If I find out any of you are mean to them, I will bust through your wall Kool-aid man style (you can tell us apart because I'll scream "oh no"), pick you up by the scruff of your neck, and depending on how recently I've watched Sea Biscuit, give you a stern talking to about Toby McGuire I mean how could one guy get so many good movie roles by being such a bad actor? I honesty can't figure it out. I will be back for many more victorious meals. Of course, food was perfect!
author: Creed M.

description:
I ordered 2 cappuccinos TO GO. I noticed that she was struggling, making coffees and taking orders at the same time. So, to kill time I washed my hands in their restroom, sat down, looked at some books on their shelves, went outside and back inside while I was waiting. Meanwhile, so many other customers were in & out the door with their drinks (AND THEY CAME IN 10-15 MINUTES AFTER ME) and I'm still there waiting....and....waiting. 

Finally, she called "1 cappuccino", and put 1 cappuccino on the counter, then she started taking orders from people that just came in.  Wait, how about the other cappuccino that I ordered? At that point I was already waiting for more than 15 minutes to get one of my cappuccinos and didn't want to wait another. 5 minutes later of waiting, I asked her if I could get $4.00(cost of 1 cappuccino) back since she hadn't started making the 2nd cappuccino AT ALL. I just wanted to get my day going, not be there for 30 minutes. Her response with an attitude was "EXCUSE ME?" She annoyingly asked the arriving customers that just came in that "If You don't mind to wait for him? I've got to make his order". 

I wasn't rude back. I even could forget the whole thing if she'd just not had such a bad attitude. 

So if you wanna wait a half hour for a pretty good cappuccino then Orson's Belly is your spot. And just maybe you'll be treated like crap too. 

No hate here just the facts of my experience.

Owners response  below shows that they have internal personal problems. Not the way to do business.
author: L D.

description: Place is great awesome atmosphere and the food was delicious.  A great place to grab a bite or spend a few hours playing some of their in house board games.  The smashed avocado bagel with sriracha was delicious and their cappuccino is amazing.  Ordering a Lèige waffle for the table is a MUST.  I would advise though that on busier days you expect to spend a little more time waiting for your order as its a smaller place, but it is well worth it spending time in their fun café.  Bring a book, stay a while!
author: Nicholas P.

description: best cafe in the city, and possibly the world.  Wouldn't change a thing, and I hope they never close or move!
author: K W.

description: An amazing coffee shop. They have Turkish coffee which is so hard to find and even brew it correctly! All the coffees area superior! After going here you will go nowhere else! The pastries are fresh and so moist! I wish we lived closer!
author: Joy E.

description:
I love this place. 

Regarding environment: It's clean, open with ample natural lighting, has bar seats, small tables, and a large communal table. Also plenty or outlets. The music isn't too loud. Best of all, Super friendly staff! They actually go the extra step and bring your order to you. It definitely offers a welcoming environment. 

Food/drink: plenty of options including healthy or indulgent. Ive had the tuna melt which was delicious and on the heavier side. Well toasted bagel, house mixed tuna, and enough cheese. I've also had the Bircher meusli which is perfect! Made with almond milk and topped with fruits, nuts and almond butter! For someone who is easily tempted to eat unhealthy, it's nice to have a number of healthy options. Macchiato was on point.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Our local favorite! 

I live just around the corner and stop in frequently for their nitro coffee, an aperitif or draft beer with my boyfriend. 

Mostly though, we come in for the great company of the owners. They're hard working, entertaining, wonderful at what they do, and just great people all around! 

It is places like this that keep San Francisco the way we love it. Whether you come in for food, coffee or cocktail you'll find yourself comfortable and entertained either by the regulars or the silent movies and good music.
author: Milan G.

description:
Orson's belly was seen on many drivebys but couldn't identity until today when a parking space was available in front of their shop.

Orson's is small with 6 tables, a bench, 4 seats at a bar and 1 outside table. walls adorned with classic movie posters, shelves alongside window/walls had an eclectic collection of hardcover books. totality makes Orson's homely, very comfy  

offerings: breakfast, lunch, french crepes, turkish eats, draft beers, wines, 4 barrel/la Paz coffee, etc, (middle east/turkish sides), bagel sammies.

eats: turkish breakfast (10)
-tomato slices, dab of honey, dab of jam, organic turkish olives, 2 halves boiled egg, locally sourced pita bread, creamy feta cheese, cucumber slices.
-authentic turkish breakfast. according to owner (GEM), tasty everything fresh.
simple, nutritious, 

brew: turkish coffee(5)comped
-bolder, grainier version of expresso as i know it, a "shot" in a bronze vessel

imbibe: "malbec" wine, (sampling). south american
-interesting red wine with sweet notes..

take outs:
-came across "Gem" yesterday in Oaktown sourcing craft beer for resale
appears all offerings are meticuously sourced
-Gem mentioned "popups" may occur on the weekend, fabulous idea!
-"Orson's Belly" fits my search for virgin eats, so 5 stars, no reservations, no rounding up.
-agreed to have a pic taken with Gem. choose Orson Welles pic as backdrop. did fistbump when we departed. (no, it's not that  "I'm back", just i'm for real, not a troll as a disgruntled 
3 starred shopowner described me.).
-America needs more immigrants like Gem who (collectively) will make American Great again.
author: Victor G.

description: 100% the best cafe ever! Good beer, food, wine and coffee! So so good, amazing service and owners. They got my dog water, served us on the patio and were so kind. If I could give 6 stars I would!!!!
author: Melissa R.

description:
Over a year in San Francisco and I finally found a neighborhood spot (granted I moved to my current neighborhood only a couple of months ago) that I feel like I can spend a few hours at and get some work done or just have a nice lazy Saturday/Sunday at. 

First of all, the decor here is super cute. Orson Wells movie posters, lots of light and color, and just overall a really fun and cool place. 

The menu isn't huge but has a bunch of bagel sandwiches, salads, quiche, Turkish breakfast, and museli. In the evening, they have mezze platters. They also have various coffee drinks, beer, wine, and sangria. 

I had their cheese quiche which came with a huge pile of mixed greens that were lightly dressed. It was pretty good though I wish the quiche was a little hotter and the crust more toasted. I also had a cappuccino which I though was alright but lacking the slight sweetness I expect from a very well made cappuccino. Probably would give the food and coffee I had 3 and a half stars.

I still love the shop though and the service was friendly and warm as well. I would definitely come back and look forward to trying more of their menu and also their mezze platters one day.
author: Seema U.

description:
Wow. What a sweet place!

It's got great ambiance with an extensive offering of vermouth, aperitifs, and beers as well as cafe fare, such as coffee. 

To top it off, the proprietors are awesome. This is clearly a labor of love and it shows in their friendly and welcoming warmth.
author: InannaMouse M.

description: I feel at peace when I'm here, sipping Turkish coffee and chatting up the owners behind the bar.
author: Adam S.

description:
Though this place is only a block from Golden Gate Park, this place is a hidden gem. They have incredible food (but not cheap) and really well made coffee drinks. There's a lot of seating here and the whole place is well decorated. They also usually play pretty good tunes. 

It's a great place to work on stuff or read...but one thing, it's definitely a communal place so if you can't work with chatter, maybe come at a different time. I would definitely recommend bringing a friend cause it's the vibe is perfect for catching up!
author: Michelle N.

description: So lucky to live a block away from Orson's. It's a great place to grab a drink, catch up with friends, or have a light dinner.
author: Anna M.

description:
Orson's Belly is a modern, chic little cafe decorated with vintage movie posters. The atmosphere is relaxing and features a few tables and benches to eat/chat/study on. 

Originally, I came to try the Superfood Waffle which featured housemade peanut butter and fresh fruit. It's not on the menu now...and in it's place is the Superfood Bagel. This dish features your choice of bagel slathered generously with store-bought almond butter and topped with thin slices of bananas, chia seeds, and agave. Though good, it seems to be a bit of a downgrade from its previous superfood version.

I paired my bagel with a cappuccino. I found the foam to be pretty thin and it dissolved rather quickly back into the coffee. The addition of a biscoff cookie on the side is nice though.

Overall, it was a 3.5 star experience...however...

One snafu that I found a bit weird was that both people behind the counter couldn't identify the pastry items being sold. "It might be ____ or ____" isn't exactly reassuring...
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Superfood Waffle with housemade peanut butter was legit like mmfwffmmhh can't talk because the roof of your mouth is stuck to everything else.

Quiche (savory) interestingly came with strawberries. I ended up with strawberries on every plate. For days.

Cold Brew $4 was strong. Had me going around town like I was in a different place altogether.

Clean digs. Already full of strollers.
author: Dan B.

description:
We stopped here early on a Saturday morning and waited about a half hour for the food to come out, which actually isn't too long of a wait. However:

My fiancee ordered a waffle and it was diminutive (for how much we paid and waited)
and I ordered a crepe and it was flavorless and extremely thin (it came with a cup of honey for dipping in) 

I was less than impressed, in fact I was pretty disappointed. Their coffee might be good? I wouldn't return based on my experience.
author: Brendan M.

description: This place is fantastic. Friendly service. Exquisite, simple, fresh food. I wanted to order everything on the menu just to try a bite.
author: Madison M.

description:
Friday morning usually is a kind of happy, busy and anxious day. I was around Golden Gate Park, craving for a healthy breakfast, and I found Orson's Belly on Yelp.
This place offers much more than a excellent coffee (Latté and Mocha; and Turkish Coffee) 
The couple working here, have a great smile and service, that match with a cozy and thematic coffee house. About the environment, Orson's Belly is like a perfect combination of informal reading place, (the place have books available to anyone, wi-fi and films being projected on the wall, vintage posters of Orson's Welles, and fancy chandeliers) with a great coffee house. What someone can desire more? I strongly recommend Orson's Belly, you will not be disappointed.
author: Rubim B.

description: This is a great little neighborhood gem.  Sadly, I moved away recently.  The owners are very friendly and the Sangria and waffles are the best ever.
author: Georgianne C.

description: I really like this place - the vibe is neighborhoody and friendly and they do game nights. The food is good too. I want to like this place more however the 8AM opening time is a big bummer. Maybe this place should be thought of more as a restaurant and less as a coffee spot. Nice people.
author: Vaughn B.

description: Affogato was delicious and perfect. It's a scoop of delicious vanilla ice cream and a shot of espresso over it. It was just like heaven. The team there was friendly and attentive. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Joanna C.

description: Love this coffee shop! Such warm and friendly owners. A definite neighborhood spot with huge bagel sandwiches. Will try the Turkish breakfast next time. On a side note the music was perfectly selected - not distracting and at the right volume level. It gets crowded - I stayed for a couple of hours and people hold onto their spots. So snag your seat, enjoy the great selections of loose leaf teas, coffee drinks etc. I would love to see the nighttime vibe - it looks like it could transition easily into a beautiful wine bar.
author: jennifer m.

description: Quiet spot for coffee and a good book, staff was friendly and service was quick. A bit pricey-- two breakfast bagels and two coffees came out to $28 plus tip. But if you're planning to hang around for a while it's worth it since it's not so crowded and the staff won't bother you about hogging the table.
author: Nat E.

description: Went here a couple of weekends ago with my mom for brunch. Such a great place and vibe. Everything we ordered was excellent and appropriately portions. I wish they had a wider selection of food and drinks, though what they have is greats o got the Bellini, waffle and cappuccino! Definitely a place to visit in he inner Richmond.
author: Justine J.

description:
Interesting café in a part of the neighborhood where the main foot traffic is a couple blocks away. Even with the location, it's quite a gem of the neighborhood weigh its unique ambience with heavy influences of Orson Welles. If you are in the area, I'm sure you've seen a chalkboard sign of their Turkish coffee, which is "black as hell, strong as death, sweet as love".

This review would be my second go-around with Orson's Belly, with the first time trying the Turkish coffee to go. Comes with a piece of Turkish delight, by the way. 

Round two, I decided to stay and have a little breakfast. The menu updated from the pictures I saw prior to dining in and they have quite a list to skim through. This isn't you fast food, $6 meal type joint, so prepare yourself for $9+ items. 

I went for the muesli, not something I usually eat on a regular basis and it's vegan, definitely not my typical choice. Now I'm not vegan and likely won't plan to be vegan (apologies to any vegan), but for a vegan breakfast, the muesli really isn't all that bad. The agave syrup drizzle was the thing that made out delicious and pulled the while dish together. It's served cold, yet it is surprisingly filling. Pair that with Turkish coffee, slightly sweeten this time, and it isn't a bad breakfast! Pricey, but not bad! Oh, let's not forget that Turkish delight! Rose flavored too!

If you have the time in the morning, Orson's Belly is a quiet little café with plenty of books inside to get lost in. The price might be a little steep, but a great place to splurge a little and enjoy some warm company the staff gives.
author: Jeremy L.

description:
Absolutely my favorite cafe in the city, if not the world, by a huge margin. The owners are awesome and some of the friendliest people I know. The coffee, available as espresso, pour over, or Turkish, is consistently excellent. The food is light but delicious. The space is small but quaintly decorated with classic movie posters, books, and art. They often play jazz, and have an old movie playing silently on the wall. There's a table on the sidewalk if you prefer sitting outside (being off the main streets in the Richmond, it's usually pretty calm), and the wifi makes this a popular study spot. 

They periodically host lectures on different directors, as well as the occasional workshop.
author: Zach K.

description: We were staying nearby and decided to get lunch here. We got the mashed avocado and the tuna melt bagels. Loved that the bagels came with salad to add freshness and tartness. The bagels themselves were generously filled and well seasoned. A nice neighborhood spot with tasty, generously portioned food. The hot chocolate was good too.
author: Sana H.

description:
So far from being a Neighborhood Gem!  First, they serve wine in a recycled jam jar for $10, it gave the impression of drinking wine from a box with a gold ribbon price.  Secondly, they try too hard overly friendly at times annoying, especially when saying her name incorrectly.  She continues to overly correct you but in turn she is butchering your name.  

I've not tried the food as the menu was unappealing.  The interior was greatly done but missed the spot in the representation of film memorabilia.  The wall featuring the film is as poorly visible the lighting from the windows washes out the image.  
What I was most excited about was it being a dog friendly place so that was a 5 star and a big deal to me!  Unfortunately, it was short lived as there was another patron who owns two dog aggressive Shih Tzu mixed. They go ballistic seeing another dog entering and start gunning toward you. I've conveyed to the female behind the counter, dogs who behave such a way should not be allowed in establishment as I've gotten bitten from the exact situation.  To make matters worse he yelled you F****B****!

The women behind counter says "he's a loyal customer" justifying the behavior as okay.  
BEWARE of Dogs when you bring your children there!
author: L. G.

description: This is the local cafe that takes you to Europe. Unlike most places that want you to buy and get out, here they want you to stay and relax.  Amazing coffee, great food, and probably the only vermouth bar in the city, it's a must stop if you are in the area.
author: Justin P.

description:
Awesome coffee shop and bar!

- wifi 
- bright
- wine ... and half off bottles from 4-6pm happy hour.
- beer on tap!
- lovely owners :)
- quiet... a cool spot to go to have a conversation, or work.
author: Tanya M.

description:
Just discovered OB; walking distance from work.

Awesome place. The owners are friendly and sweet. The espresso is strong, with a bite. The salads are fresh and delicious (love the pickled onions).

Will be my regular for coffee and salads during the week :).
author: Confetti M.

description: My favorite coffee shop in the city! Staff are super friendly and their waffles are a must try!
author: P J.

description:
Easy like Sunday morning kind of place.
Simple yet unique menu, decent wine and beer selection, delicious coffee and friendly staff. Good vegan & vegetarian options. Cute decor. I dig this kind of place.
author: Michelle G.

description: Such an incredible and welcoming environment. The owners (husband and wife) bring the BEST vibe to this coffee shop. From the decor to the tasty and innovative menu, this couple knows what they're doing. They each bring a uniqueness to the coffee shop that is often lost in others. If you have ever thought about stopping by, don't hesitate. You will be happy you did.
author: Racquel T.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and was so happy when this place opened up.  It's one of the few places in the Outer Richmond that serves good coffee.  The owners are so considerate and go above and beyond to give good service ( literally rose their skateboard to get more avocados for  friends and I when we ordered avocado toast and they were out).  

Little gem in the Richmond to check out.  Great for studying and working also.
author: Shelby N.

description: Amazing food, hip ambiance, friendly customer service, clean, comfy seating, what more can you ask for? The place is great for working, meetings, or for people on a date, or bringing kids. They serve great coffee, tea, lattes, beer, wine and more. This place really seems to cater to many situations whether you are alone or socially. It's got a cool, yet unpretentious, relaxed neighborhood vibe. I love the artful design (edison bulb lighting, vintage wallpaper, local artists/prints featured, etc.) and film touches with books and games spread out and a nostalgic film playing via a projector on the wall plus tables and chalk outside for the kids to draw on the sidewalk. The nice owners are directly involved in their business and take care of customers. So glad to have these guys here!
author: Joan L.

description: Fantastic chill neighborhood place! I spent the day working there and everyone is incredibly nice. Owners and customers alike. They have good tea, snacks and beer! Definitely stop in and support these wonderful people, they seem to support everyone in the neighborhood in such a genuine way.
author: Danger R.

description: Unique neighborhood spot with unique aesthetic and super friendly staff. I bring friends here from all over they city and they just love the atmosphere and nibbles. I love to study here also! Would definitely recomend their various bagels and superb coffee and teas.
author: Katy L.

description: This place has a really cool ambiance, very hip and cute. They project movies on the wall! However, when I went the service wasn't great. The lady felt a little pretentious when she assumed I didn't know what cold brew was, but perhaps that's my own fault. Coffee was a 3.5/5, but the ambiance boosts it to a 4.
author: Victoria G.

description: I recently moved to the neighbourhood and this cafe is absolutely fantastic. It is one of my favourite place to hang out in the city. Great place to work on projects, study or just chat. Food is delicious and presentation is beautiful. Coffee is on point and the homemade ice cream is one of the best I have ever had (comparable to Bi Rite and other amazing small batch ice cream). There is also a selection of beer, wine and cocktails that I haven't tried yet, but seem legit. Bonus: the owners are the nicest and friendliest people and their passion is obvious.
author: Emmanuelle D.

description: Great place to study and catch up on work. I love the decor at this place! This cafe is on the smaller side with small tables inside and outside and a large communal table. I ordered the Turkish coffee and the Turkish Breakfast, both of which were really good. I will probably go for a regular coffee next time I come though. Meals are a bit pricey and it took a while for the food to be ready.
author: Chantal D.

description: I went twice in one day and both times it was weirdly closed and not aligned either their hours!!! Very annoying but looks cute if you can catch t when you can actually walk inside
author: Sarah G.

description: I am very impressed with this place. I had been waiting for something like this to open up in the area and it has been nice to have them here. The owner and staff are always so friendly and welcoming, it almost feels like you are stopping by a friends house. I usually just grab a coffee or something Togo to get my day started but it's a cute place to sit and relax with coffee, a beer, a book, or get some work in. The food is relatively simple but everything that I've tried has been fantastic and I'm surprised they are able to work out of the little space they have. There is not much in the area like this so it's perfect.
author: Kyle H.

description: I like this place , the staff is friendly the coffee and lattes are good .the place is clean ,plenty of seating a good little place in the Richmond District. But the food is OK I had the waffle I was not crazy about it it seems like it was heated up in the microwave very chewy. If you have any kind of nut allergy your limited on what you can have there. It needs to improve on the food here. They do you have a nice selection of beer.
author: Pat C.

description: Ok 5 stars for bringing a real cute coffee shop to this neighborhood, much needed pretty spot for the neighborhood.
author: Rose R.

description: Wanted to try this cafe for months now and made it out here but closed though should be opened at 8am. 4 others patrons waiting outside in the cold at 8:06am. Guess I will have to go another cafe that is reliable to be opened.
author: N L.

description:
I prefer direct feedback when possible.  So I first contacted Orson's Belly via email to share my experience with them.  Their place has a lot of potential and I didn't want to arbitrarily give them a bad Yelp review based one experience.  Here is a verbatim copy of our singular correspondence.

 
"I came in at around 130 on Saturday, I ordered a quiche and a avocado egg bagel sandwich. The quiche took 25 minutes and the sandwich 30. Someone who arrived 15 minutes later got there to go food before I got mine. I was so hungry when the quiche came out, I didn't investigate the inside and burned my mouth. While I was sitting at the bar another patron came up to remind them about the food he ordered that they had clearly forgotten about . Your café is really cute and it's much needed in that neighborhood, but you need to get your sh*t together."

Response:
"Sorry, we cannot take responsibility if you burn your mouth on the food. 
If you want a place with their "sh*t" together go to Peets. It' Saturday. Get over it."
author: Steven G.

description:
Really cute cafe, and I would go back for a glass of wine to unwind.  

I would caution you that the service is slow, so be prepared to wait 20 minutes on two coffee drinks and  bagels (and we were the first to receive service).
author: k s.

description: Charming modern cafe with super-friendly owners, interesting, yummy choices... and the N.Y. Times! What could be better!
author: Debbie K.

description: Good coffee, nice vibe, friendly folks, and happy that they have vegan options! Recommended!
author: D. B.

description:
Not to say the food is bad here, it's just very, very underwhelming. Like something I could make in my own kitchen. I had the avocado and boiled egg breakfast sandwich served with a side of macerated strawberries. The bagel was doused in sriracha, which I didn't hate, but I could have literally made that at home for cheaper. And the "macerated strawberries" on the side were probably frozen strawberries cooked with a ton of sugar. Nothing about that sounds good unless it's on top of a stack of pancakes or waffles, not with my savory bagel. Give me a side salad or a bowl of fresh fruit. 
I'm sure I'll be back for maybe a coffee or something quick and convenient, but wouldn't go out of my way to come back.
author: Molly A.

description:
Such a great cafe! Good coffee and food as well as plenty of space to study.
The music is a perfect volume for studying or conversation- not too loud.
author: Anna Y.

description: I tried the Turkish coffee and the smoked salmon bagel sandwich.  I loved the sandwich. I requested to not have the yogurt sauce and the cashier offered me another replacement which was really nice. So I had cream cheese on it instead. I loved the side salad that came with it. I wish they asked if I wanted the salad or the macerated strawberries. I wish they gave me that choice like it was on the menu. The Turkish coffee was alright. It was much smaller than I pictured. And it was very little coffee. Most of it was the thick coffee grounds that had sunk to the bottom. I also thought they gave two Turkish delights, but I only got one. That was disappointing and the reason why I only gave 3 stars. This place is pricey. It is not someplace I would go everyday, but rather for special occasions.
author: Anne F.

description: Great cafe with solid food options - including Turkish muhamara - great coffee, and a rotating beer tap of interesting beers. Friendly staff and great environs. A solid European style cafe in the Richmond.
author: Nate S.

description:
Orson's Belly is a casual brunch/cafe with good food and pretty good prices. The layout is very welcoming and feels just like a vintage home, with a projection of classic film on a wall and books lined up along another. There is a decent amount of seating, and is set in a way so that the space feels very large. The owners are incredibly friendly and helpful, recommending types of bagels and inquiring about the text on my shirt.

I came with a friend and was able to try the muesli and a bit of Speculoo's cookie butter and marshmallow fluff bagel. The muesli, a vegan option, is simple yet tasty, with cinnamon to add a kick of flavor and agave to sweeten it up, along with other yummy ingredients. The bagel had a very generous amount of cookie butter and marshmallow fluff, and was pretty creamy - the flavors blended together amazingly. They also serve De La Paz, which was pretty decent in latte form. Overall, a great spot in the Richmond and worth trying out at least once!
author: Cindy N.

description:
This place is a gem! 
I love their lattes, ambiance, and staff. Super cute place to chill on something warm and caffeinated while doing work or meeting up with a friend. 

I would definitely recommend this cafe to anyone strolling around our homey richmond neighborhood :)
author: Katie 2.

description:
The Turkish breakfast is so delicious! The pita bread is fantastic. We also had the salmon bagel & the egg/ avocado bagel. Each item is fresh, light, and with a decidedly Turkish flair. 

Look forward to eating here often, and so happy it's in the neighborhood!
author: Anna G.

description: Neighborhood place, strong coffee, good food, great service, nice interior, lovely Turkish owners, sense of community, frequent events, jazz music. Hard to ask more for a cafe.
author: Changbai L.

description:
Love his place, just opened and has it down. Great food, great coffee great people. I have been waiting for Orson's Belly to open for so long now, I went on opening day and it did not disappoint.
Read an earlier review and they mentioned the  price of coffee in comparison to the rest of the city, show me a $2.50 coffee and I'm there, I haven't paid less the $4 for a coffee in 5 years!
Highly recommended to everyone in the neighbourhood, check it out!
author: Jon B.

description: Great ambiance. Phenomenal food. Very comfortable and easy to have a nice conversation. Hummus and tuna salad were A+. I'll be back soon.
author: Sandra B.

description: I really enjoy having coffee and chatting it up with the locals. The owners are friendly and make strong and delicious coffee. My kind of café.
author: George B.

description:
This is a great addition to the Outer Richmond!
Coffee - the core of a cafe for me. The barista has the skills sufficient to satisfy a coffee snob like me. In saying this, my first Almond milk latte was on the hot side and frothiness could be worked on; he was fine with normal milk. The coffee beans thay use I am not a fan of. I'm not sure if this is the Turkish influence, but far too bitter for me.

Ambiance - great relaxed atmosphere, with old movies projected on one wall, and keeping with the theme movies posters of similar era, and chill background music.

Service - I think the couple that work there are the owners, as they are very friendly, passionate, and the lady is eager to please in a good happy customer way.

I think they are a great addition to the neighborhood. I will definitely keep going back. I'm also eager to see their slow changes and development as they grow.

Improvement suggestion: consider a second type of coffee bean offering.
author: Kristine B.

description: I love their mashed avocado bagel! Their coffee is also stellar. The owners are almost always here, working behind the counter and are so friendly. Great brunch spot.
author: Angela B.

description: Friendly, bright, cinephile-centric cafe. Homey touches like a library and games, with a movie projected on a wall. Probably the brightest wall, not optimal for projection, but I liked the touch nonetheless. I must try the Turkish coffee next visit. Sounds appropriately dangerous! I might try the cafe food on offer, but a bit steep. Maybe it will be worth the price.
author: E. W.

description: Rad place, very happy to have this friendly coffee shop in the neighborhood. The owners are genuine and kind, and they're always playing beautifully curated films. One of those places you want to keep secret, but also feel the need to support in anyway possible. Coffee and treats are delicious. I'm a lush for the sangria. Enjoy!
author: M.R. Rogers ..

description: Decided to give this cafe a try since I live close by but I was super disappointed after ordering what they thought was an iced chai latte. I first asked the woman working if they made chai lattes because I didn't see it on the giant wall menu. She told me they did but when I got my drink it was literally milk, ice, and a floating tea bag....
author: Kaitlin F.

description:
We love Orson's Belly- especially their Sat and Sunday night mezze which is delicious.
The place is spotless, friendly and they have a wide variety of beer and wine (especially local wheat beer),
author: Penny K.

description: Excellent food, outstanding service, very pleasant friendly atmosphere. They constantly flash great classic movies.
author: Victor R.

description: Great new cafe! Love the decor and the Turkish breakfast and the old-school movies they show on the wall (not to mention the regular Sunday discourses on classic films). Super nice owners/staff and a great place to hang out.
author: Dan S.

description: So happy a coffee shop like this has opened in my neighborhood. The vibe is relaxed, staff is friendly, the coffee and food is tasty and fresh, and I love the film theme throughout.
author: Caity W.

description: I live right around the corner from Orson's Belly, and I try and eat there at least once a weekend. I would love to eat breakfast there more during the week but they open at 8am which is too late for me unfortunately.  Their sangria is perfect for a weekend treat! Also the bagel sandwiches, mixed greens, and strawberries ALWAYS taste fresh. Number one fav purchase at Orson's Belly is the Turkish Breakfast with an americano. It will never fail!
author: Rosie O.

description: Was really happy to see a new café pop up near our apartment. Orsons is a really nice and chill spot with a theme that doesn't feel over done. Been here twice for breakfast and both times have really liked the food. The Turkish breakfast is my favorite: a platter  of very fresh vegetables that must have been lightly seasoned, some cheese from heaven and fresh hot bread. Check it out!
author: Matt G.

description: Just the sort of place I was hoping would pop up in the neighborhood. This is the perfect cafe to unwind and have coffee, beer, wine (sangria!) and a bite to eat. The atmosohere is relaxed and modern, with a great friendly vibe. Extra points for playing classic movies!
author: Justin P.

description:
3.5 stars. 
Love the space. Nice folks, average prices, but not a lot of milk or sweetener options.
author: Dis S.

description: You get the feeling here that the owners started this business because they love people. And film, and coffee, and food -- but people above all. They're welcoming and interesting and they've made our neighborhood feel like a community again. Third-wave coffee shops are sprouting up every day in #newsanfrancisco but too often they have cold vibes, uncomfortable seating, and just no... magic. Orson's Belly proves hip & modern is not mutually exclusive with warm and homey. I recommend the cold muesli for breakfast (so good with a hot beverage), veggie cobb for lunch, and a meze platter with Fort Point beer beer for an early dinner. They're also super kid-friendly! And work-friendly (plenty of outlets, good wifi). Perfect cafe experience.
author: Holly B.

description: Cute new coffee brunch spot in the Richmond, super friendly staff! The place is movie themed with tasty Turkish food. We got to the smoked salmon bagel sandwich, the salmon was fresh and the salad dressed with a great vinaigrette. I really recommend to anyone out here in the Richmond!
author: Matthew R.

description: Love this bright clean cafe!  Delicious mezze plate was more than enough for two of us.  And the mocha coffe is so rich -- a fantastic addition to the neighborhood.
author: Susan S.

description: Came in this morning to try out the Turkish coffee, came to me piping hot and accompanied with the best Turkish delight I've ever had! The hummus and pita bread is fantastic as well. Super nice service from the ladies, this morning's copy of the NYT, and charming ambience to boot. Will be back, over and over, I hope. :)
author: Lauren M.

description: We went on the first day because my son and his girlfriend live just a few blocks away.  It's good. I got a "farro salad" that isn't on their online menu (http://www.orsonsbelly.com/food.html), so maybe they don't make it any more.  It was pretty good, and plenty large, but took a long time to make.  We got it 10-15 minutes after the other meals in our party, around the time they were finishing.  I wish they would have told us that it would take 20-30 minutes to make (and we were practically the only people in there!).  If I knew it would take so long, I would have ordered the apple pie.   The coffee was good.  There was an interesting french movie playing on the projector.  The place is clean and bright, and the staff was friendly.   Too bad our (well, my) food didn't arrive faster.  Even so, it's likely I'll go back next time I'm visiting Richmond.
author: David L.

description: Interesting/cool vibe. Loved the muesli - got it without agave and it was definitely sweet enough, though they gave it to me on the side in case I wanted it. My friends loved their smoked salmon bagel sandwiches. The only weird thing was it came with a side of grapes and they were unwashed (visible dirt).
author: Nina S.

description: I appreciate the long review written about this restaurant, but wanted to add some positive points. We made our first trip there today and ordered the vegetarian Cobb and chickpea salads and a large chocolate chip with oatmeal cookie. All 3 items were delicious, more than ample in size, and food I would order again. The owners are very enthusiastic and friendly and I'm sure will appreciate any suggestions people have to make.
author: Terry H.

description: So happy to see this new neighborhood spot open.  Cute, modern, light, airy, clean place with plenty of seating.  Coffee and berry tartlet were excellent.  Staff were very nice.  I love that it's open so early on the weekends.  Kid and dog friendly, as evidenced by the water bowls and chalk outside.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Nicole S.

description: What a great neighborhood cafe. Recommend any and all of their drinks, especially the coffee. Best Coffee in the neighborhood. Salads/breakfast items are savory and tasty. Make this your local spot!
author: Andrew L.

description: Came here for brunch on a Saturday morning and absolutely loved it!! The cafe is bright and beautifully decorated. We loved the movie theme which gives the cafe a unique touch. The food was scrumptious- ordered the salmon bagel which came with a large side salad. The owners are lovely people who greeted everyone with a smile :) will definitely be coming back!!
author: Eda A.

description: Very cool place. Stumbled upon it. In awkward location but very welcoming. Option between coffee and wines, perfect. Friendly staff:)
author: Jacob N.

description: Really like this new cafe in my neighborhood. The couple that runs the place are super nice and welcoming. The coffee is very good, and the ambiance is great, I have tried the bagels and pastries which are delicious. One of these days I will have to make it over for happy hour!
author: Christina K.

description: Great cafe. The owners are really nice and the Turkish breakfast is delicious. I'm looking forward to the film talks and showings.
author: Matthew W.
